website_summaries.verdict: A solid hand truck designed for tackling steps and stairs; lots of users are very satisfied.
pros: It has two handles for easier, more ergonomic operation
Applauded by owners for its ability to handle stairs better than a regular hand truck

customer_reviews.title: No More Bumping
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great for hauling stuff up and down stairs. No more bumpety-bump and heavy jerks on your arms. In fact, it's as if the entire load was sliding down or up an incline. You have to remember that as you get started down the stairs -- there won't be a stair stop each tread so you can readjust your grip. Be ready and slide easily! You can control the descent and the pull on your arms by changing the angle of the body on the way down. This is a great tool.
customer_reviews.author: Mahatma Head

customer_reviews.title: Solid Stair Handcart
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up specifically for moving bulky items up and down stairs (specifically Xmas items as the offspring has moved out). The handtruck is rock solid (close to a work of art if you are a tool guy). It went together, note you need your own tools for this - if you are buying a hand truck at this price point you doubtlessly have some tools (helps to have a clamp to pull the 4 part top handle together for the first bolt on each side). It works as I had hoped, bull nose on oak stairs are no issue, neither was an overhanging threshold (this one really surprised me).
customer_reviews.author: mrp

customer_reviews.title: This is great for getting items up a set of straight stairs
customer_reviews.text: This is great for getting items up a set of straight stairs. However, it has a horrible turn radius. I get items up to the 2nd level of my house fine. But the third floor has a 90 degree turn at the top landing. It's useless for that. Well built and not too difficult to assemble. The direction leave out the fact that there is a bushing that needs to be installed on each set wheels. Figured that out after I put it together!
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: the VERY BEST HEAVY DUTY dolly gor $100
customer_reviews.text: a little tricky to assemble so go to TykeSupply.com for a detailed video- this is COMMERCIAL QUALITY dolly i would haul any size FRIG without any concern *** the nose plate rest flush with the floor for EASY loading/unloading *** the wheel assembly is strong as a bull *** the handle height is 60"- perfect for EASY tilting & moving the load *** the price is a great VALUE i don't understand how some other reviewers can give it less than 5*s this is truly a quality hand truck
customer_reviews.author: BRUCE D.

customer_reviews.title: Large Pneumatic Tires Work Better.
customer_reviews.text: I am a home owner who owns 4 different hand trucks. I use them primarily to move items from my front gate and from my vehicle into my elevated home(2nd story). I purchased this 3 rotating tire hand truck thinking that it would make the job easier and it did not do that. I am back to using my 30$ large pneumatic tire hand truck. This hand truck is very well made, but if it doesn't make work easier, so what good is it?
customer_reviews.author: William E. Goff

customer_reviews.title: Decent price for aluminum hand truck.
customer_reviews.text: If you use hand trucks on a regular basis and have to go up and down stairs this truck does make it easier. Long handle is a plus. You can tell from pics that it was going to be heavier than a normal hand truck, even a steel one. I expected that. You should also be able to tell that 4 wheels contacting ground would make it harder to turn. Careful making tight turns as it will mark floor. Would have given 5 stars if there wasn't so much slop in wheel assembly. Thinking might have to add a washer or two inside and outside of wheel assembly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I need to empty an attic of 100 years of stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this specifically to help clean out my Father-in-laws house which has three stories of narrow steep stairs. Taking out various furniture, boxes and trunks out of the attic was made possible for me to do alone with this hand truck as I could get heavy and awkward items down the stairs by myself using this hand truck. Well build easy to put together and really works well on stairs. As others have commented because of the multiple wheels it doesn't turn easily especially on carpets, but I didn't find this to be to much of a problem.
customer_reviews.author: pccrider

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Dual wheels are a little difficult to turn in a tight space, however the unit was designed to tackle stairs and this it does well! Beware; the unit goes UP the stairs nicely but will go down stairs very quickly, so you want to be ready with a good grip on the dolly!
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Ordered this for my friend.He loves it.
customer_reviews.text: Is JUST what he needed for his couple of steps into his house.This hand truck is very,very heavy duty.The tires are solid rubber and the wheels that the tires are mounted on are heavy metal.If you want a heavy duty hand dolley that will do the job...and withstand the test of time...this is the one.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Well built, heavy duty... but did not fit our stairs, scary descent!
customer_reviews.text: Needs bigger wheels and distance between axles to climb and descend stairs easier. Tall strong man can make it work... but it was a Scary experience when my wife tried it. That said... The device is solid, heavy, and Well made, but sorry to say... it didn't work well for us. Be safe, be kind... make cool stuff! -=Skip=- -=iii=0
customer_reviews.author: Skip

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly well made, and designed. It is a ...
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly well made, and designed. It is a bit hard to turn when you have a load on it, but that can be fixed by strapping two of the wheels so that only one on each side is in contact with the rolling surface. I cut a wood block to fit between the uprights and the upper wheels then strapped the wheels up against the wood. It works perfectly now as a two wheeler.
customer_reviews.author: hireziii

customer_reviews.title: B+ with reservations.
customer_reviews.text: Does stairs well. Not good on corners or soft or rough ground (wheels are small and narrow). Well built and rugged but somewhat difficult to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: puff1776

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality assurance
customer_reviews.text: The one that was sent to us was defective. One of the parts did not have the holes drilled correctly, and the wheel assembly could not be attached because of this. Amazon is sending another one so I will update if that one doesn't have the same issue.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time with instructions
customer_reviews.text: The instructions are worthless. If you buy this, look at the photo, close up. Then you will have a much better understanding of how to put this together. It isn't easy, it is moderately hard until you figure it out for yourself. It is a heavy beast. The wheels are very heavy, because they are much better than anything else in this price range. This does stairs well, especially if it is a bulky 100+ lbs item.
customer_reviews.author: Carpet Cleaner

customer_reviews.title: Great climber
customer_reviews.text: The paper instructions leave out the spacer plates, otherwise simple to assemble. I love it. If you're dragging heavy packages up and down stairs, can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: doug chase

customer_reviews.title: True buyer
customer_reviews.text: Works well , Does what I need it to do , a little on the heavy side but I guess that goes along with the sturdy construction. Really well down stairs good upstairs , way better and safer than a standard hand truck , yes I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: DebY

customer_reviews.title: wrong hole
customer_reviews.text: Appears adequate for my purposes. However assembly of the handle was not easy due to malposition of the predrilled holes. I would have returned for replacement but I would have to disassemble it, repackage it, and arrange for pickup. It was easier to drill the proper positioned hole.
customer_reviews.author: F. M. Parker Jr.

customer_reviews.title: leaves streaks like having a magic marker
customer_reviews.text: It only goes straight, if you turn, you will easily leave black lines on floor, carpet or anything it rolls on. Poor design on the wheels, should be easier to turn, and why using black and not white wheels if it leaves marks and wears out quickly? I used it for one day and wheels look like they are 20 years old. I wish I can return it, or go back to one wheel deal...
customer_reviews.author: JL Safety

customer_reviews.title: as the full weight was never all on me like it is with a regular hand truck while lifting ...
customer_reviews.text: Solid construction! Exactly what I wanted. I was able to get a 85lb box out of my basement, as the full weight was never all on me like it is with a regular hand truck while lifting it up the face of each stair. It literally rolls over to the next stair.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The bottom platform doesn't reach out far enough
customer_reviews.text: The bottom platform doesn't reach out far enough for a large package. Also, it is heavy and noisy when going up or down stairs. At least it is sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Ginsberg

customer_reviews.title: Will only work for a few step obstacles. Kind ...
customer_reviews.text: Will only work for a few step obstacles. Kind of heavy and very loud when using to take stuff up to the second floor. Heavy weights are hard to control and will pull it down the stairs if not careful.
customer_reviews.author: Unanimous

customer_reviews.title: and it's great. I'm not sure how it compares to the ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this to move several thousand pounds of machine tools (in pieces) down to my basement, and it's great. I'm not sure how it compares to the much more expensive versions sold by industrial suppliers, but I haven't been able to damage it despite significant abuse, and it's a great tool.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Works fine but was a little difficult to put together
customer_reviews.text: Works fine but was a little difficult to put together. It works great going down the stairs but a little difficult to turn corners. Works great with heavy loads going down the stairs.
customer_reviews.author: SandyR

customer_reviews.title: I have trouble keeping this in sight
customer_reviews.text: I have trouble keeping this in sight because everyone wants to borrow it anytime they move stuff.
customer_reviews.author: James D. Parker

customer_reviews.title: The only things that could make this product more useful is a robot to do the walking for you
customer_reviews.text: The only things that could make this product more useful is a robot to do the walking for you. Seriously ... sell a robot that will carry me AND the boxes up a flight of stairs. Ha ha, just kidding ... no I'm not, I just want to be carried upstairs.
customer_reviews.author: Richard D.

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: watch out for the tires they will mark up your floors its not good
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Love this hand truck
customer_reviews.text: Love this hand truck.It did what is was suppose to do.I am a professional mover and I use this hand truck weekly.I'm able to carry more boxes up and down stairs now since getting this product.I give this product 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: marquis phillip

customer_reviews.title: Get one
customer_reviews.text: Excellent.works extremely well and worth every penny. Saves your back from lifting.
customer_reviews.author: J Cords

customer_reviews.title: a female - but absolutely LOVE it. Most have never seen this type of ...
customer_reviews.text: Heavy for a me, a female - but absolutely LOVE it. Most have never seen this type of hand truck - and I am the envy of all I meet. Would buy this a thousand times again!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. A learning curve going downstairs. Legs seem wobbly when unloaded but are true and stable when loaded.
customer_reviews.author: MJM

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: Dangerous when descending stairs - ripped out of my hands with 50 lb. load. The triple wheels seem to have a mechanical disadvantage on stairs.
customer_reviews.author: Big Art

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the dollar
customer_reviews.text: It’s a very strong and useful tool. Helped get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: larry small

customer_reviews.title: Good product... VERY bad directions...
customer_reviews.text: So glad we went with the heavy duty one. Works great. But the directions are all messed up. Looking at the picture on the box was better than the lousy misgiving directions..
customer_reviews.author: starhealer

customer_reviews.title: It works great
customer_reviews.text: I consider myself a strong woman, but this hand truck is so heavy, I can barely control it. It works great though
customer_reviews.author: Online Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Avoid at all costs!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Impossible to put together. Like another reviewer said the holes are not drilled properly. On mine the holes in the axle were too small for the spring pins. Also it was missing a nut. For $200 you don't expect this.
customer_reviews.author: Chi Tech Guy

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but heavy
customer_reviews.text: Works well on my stairs but it is heavy by itself.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Do not overload going up stairs (rated at ...
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly as described. Works great. Do not overload going up stairs (rated at approx. 350lbs) not built to handle much more. Very pleased with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: I recommend this to everyone
customer_reviews.text: Moving large items was a big issue for us, this made things a lot easier. I recommend this to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Gary G.

customer_reviews.title: Instructions not very useful.
customer_reviews.text: Heavy, heavy duty and seems to work great but the instructions we got were dreadful! There were parts needed but not shown or mentioned in picture instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Bekky

customer_reviews.title: Hard to get the lift started, need lots of ...
customer_reviews.text: Hard to get the lift started, need lots of backup room and when rolled on level ground, expect to hold the hand truck lower than you would with a normal two wheeled truck. Wish it had brakes for going down stairs.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Spears

customer_reviews.title: A very useful tool, do manual work is very delicate
customer_reviews.text: A very useful tool, do manual work is very delicate. Feel the wheel wear is better, fearing it in not for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: frank huang

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent build, very durable, was fairly straight-forward to assemble, using it continuously, very sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Niladri Sekhar De

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: If you think this is a light and easy one, you're wrong. Its а huge and heavy Hand Truck!
customer_reviews.author: Vladimir Karabut

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY recommend this item
customer_reviews.text: VERY light weight, yet surprisingly strong. My co-worker and I used it to haul a 480 LB air compressor pump up 6 flights of concrete stairs, and then brought a broken one of the same model down the stairs again with this item and it performed extremely well. It seriously saved us both a lot of pain and soreness compared to using a standard hand truck. HIGHLY recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: Great handtruck, surprisingly heavy but it definitely seems like ...
customer_reviews.text: Was missing one tiny piece.. Called company directly on local number... Missing piece arrived in 2 days. Fast and personable service. Great handtruck, surprisingly heavy but it definitely seems like it can handle the weight.
customer_reviews.author: JazY

customer_reviews.title: Good Solid Hand Truck
customer_reviews.text: Good solid hand truck. Yes the instruction could be clearer but not that big of deal. Takes a little time to get use to but works great on stairs.
customer_reviews.author: D. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Just moved from the 3 story house to a 2 story house. This saved a lot of work.
customer_reviews.author: chas

customer_reviews.title: It does not turn very well when you have things ...
customer_reviews.text: It does not turn very well when you have things on it. With the way the wheels are, it makes going around corners difficult. I did not feel it made going up the stairs easier.
customer_reviews.author: Natalia Lilly

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with product and price
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy duty. Not difficult to assemble. Arrived in timely fashion. Very pleased with product and price!
customer_reviews.author: Luvutah

customer_reviews.title: Needs much better instruction (or better pictures to follow)
customer_reviews.text: So far I have not even been able to assemble this hand truck. The instructions are horrible. I contacted the company and they offered to walk me through it on the phone. I wasn't happy with that idea - - way too stressful for me - - so I'm waiting to see if my son-in-law can make any more sense of it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Reinbolt

customer_reviews.title: very heavy, moving downstairs can be very dangerous. ...
customer_reviews.text: very heavy, moving downstairs can be very dangerous. I would just get the ordinary hand truck.
customer_reviews.author: JOP

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the money. Still have to use all your strength to pull it up stairs Down stairs is very dangerous it will get going very fast and is very hard to stop BEWARE.
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL G PALMER

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: amazing product and service. Came 1 week earlier than promised. easy to put together
customer_reviews.author: Lyubov Sobchuk

customer_reviews.title: Great got tired of fighting loads up an down stairs ...
customer_reviews.text: Great got tired of fighting loads up an down stairs carry load on 2 tires on even makes uneven ground a breeze
customer_reviews.author: Randy E.

customer_reviews.title: Speedier Furniture Moving
customer_reviews.text: Makes moving much easier. Works great hauling bulky items up and down steps.
customer_reviews.author: 1ofsixbillion

customer_reviews.title: but with this hand truck it made things unusually easy to move from one place to another
customer_reviews.text: I found it very beneficial where I had items that were difficult to move, but with this hand truck it made things unusually easy to move from one place to another. I especially liked the non thumping going up or down stairs, therefore I give it a 5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wheels sucked, can't steer the hand truck either than straight
customer_reviews.text: Wheels sucked, can't steer the hand truck either than straight. Wish they give me my money back
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Tires are too hard, leaves marks on carpet and floors. Very clunky on stairs. We don't use it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: bad, nasty toxic smell, defective, hard to use, problem with return, poor customer support
customer_reviews.author: Barry Lyat

customer_reviews.title: A life saver!
customer_reviews.text: This cart is expensive, but worth well more than I paid for it. I move a LOT of heavy musical equipment with it and it's a life saver on stairs. Built like a tank of solid aluminum, this thing is a capable hauler. I move 100+ lbs. at a time with almost no effort. Easy to assemble and built to last - if I lost mine, I'd buy another without hesitation! RECOMMENDED!
customer_reviews.author: zippydog

customer_reviews.title: Stair Climber
customer_reviews.text: This hand truck goes up and down steps much easier than a two wheeled hand truck. I use it to move equipment up and down steps.
customer_reviews.author: Barry C. French

product_meta.title: Tyke Supply Stair Climber Aluminum Hand Truck Commercial Quality
product_meta.description: Tyke Supply llc Aluminum Stair Climber Hand Truck. Aluminum Stair Climber Hand Truck Heavy Duty Commercial Quality. 330 LB Capacity for stair climbing 550 LB Capacity for flat level ground Nose plate: 18" Wide x 7.5" Deep Overall size: 26.3 D x 19.2 W x 60 H Weight: 37.5 LBs 3 - 6 1/4 inch Solid Rubber Tires each side. Whole wheel assembly rotates to allow the dolly to climb the stairs.
